title: The Rivals
description: David has a rival, and his name is Will Thornberry - his next door neighbor.

title: The Pills
description: Ozzie decides to diet so he can fit into a pair of size 38 pants.

title: The Fall Guy
description: Ozzie quickly regrets advising David against allowing people to take advantage of his good nature.

title: Halloween Party
description: On Halloween night, Ozzie and Thorny make plans to attend a non-costume party as Satan and a Scotsman. Meanwhile Ricky and David attend a Halloween Party at school and the Nelson household is besieged by children demanding candy - or else.

title: Riviera Ballet
description: Ozzie has tickets to the Riviera Ballet, but Harriet doesn't want him to go because the actresses will be wearing skimpy bathing suits.

title: David the Babysitter
description: David gets a babysitting job and Ozzie is worried about David and the baby.

title: Rick Goes to a Dance
description: Ricky receives a perfumed letter from his neighbor ,Julie Thornberry, inviting him to his first dance.

title: Thorny's Gift
description: Ozzie is outraged after he doesn't receive a timely 'thank you' for the birthday gift he sent to Thorny.

title: Boys' Christmas Money
description: The boys want to earn extra money for Christmas, so Ozzie gives them permission to look for work.

title: Late Christmas Gift
description: It's Christmas Day at the Nelson's, a joyous occasion marked by one glitch - the catcher's mitt Ozzie ordered for Rick never arrived. That evening, Ozzie and Rick drive to another family named Nelson thinking that the package might have been delivered by mistake. The package isn't there, either, but Ozzie and his son are struck by how the family, a single mom and three young children, and received so little at Christmas compared to their own relative prosperity. Ozzie organizes the neighbors, and with David playing Santa Claus, treat the other Nelson family to a second Christmas Eve. Later that evening, a package holding Rick's catcher's mitt mysteriously reappears under the Christmas tree.

title: Tuba Incident
description: Ozzie wants to establish that he's head-of-the-household, and Harriet wants to be a good wife. Marital strife ensues.

title: Rover Boys
description: While discussing The Rover Boys' books with Thorny, Ozzie takes off to check out a book at the library, hoping to prove Thorny wrong. But when he's caught with a big book, one of his boys' teachers is convinced he knows a lot about the Peloponnesian War and asks him to lead a book discussion. Thorny is just to proud to admit the truth and decides to learn everything he can before the PTA meeting.

title: Separate Rooms
description: David and Ricky finally get their own separate rooms - with hilarious results.

title: Valentine Show
description: Ozzie and Harriet are concerned that David will blow all the money he's saved on a new girl he's taking to a Valentine's Day dance.

title: The Traffic Signal
description: There's a new traffic signal, and no one knows who should take the credit or get the blame.

title: Dental Receptionist
description: Ozzie soon regrets a flirtatious moment shared with his dentist's new southern belle receptionist.

title: The Speech
description: Ozzie painstakingly rehearses for a speech.

title: Bowling Alley
description: Fearing that Ozzie is coming down with a cold, Harriet orders her husband to spend the evening convalescing and then goes shopping with a friend. Ozzie manages a rapid recovery when Thorny reminds him of a date they made to go bowling.

title: The Orchid and the Violet
description: It's spring, and love is in the air, so Ozzie wants to surprise Harriet by having a bunch of violets delivered to her. When orchids show up, instead, Ozzie suspects they're from an old rich boy friend of Harriet's.

title: Pancake Mix
description: Hasty Tasty Pancake Company is offering a double-your-money-back guarantee, so Ricky decides to apply for a refund.

title: Fish Story
description: To prove a point, Ozzie starts a rumor in the neighborhood by tricking his best friend Thorny into believing that the fish are biting like crazy in Mud Basin.

title: Night School
description: Ozzie finds out from Thorny that he is taking adult education courses at the local high school in the evenings. So Ozzie decides to take some classes and Harriet signs up too.

title: The Boxing Matches
description: Ozzie gets roped into agreeing to fight Thorny in a boxing exhibition match to be held at tonight's Boy Scout rally.

title: A Door Key for David
description: David is given his first house key and the responsibility that goes with it.

title: The Play's the Thing
description: Ozzie is brimming with enthusiasm about appearing in the PTA pageant's play, until he learns that his role is the front end of Robin Hood's horse.

title: Oscillating Ozzie
description: Ozzie is stuck in his conservative routine, until he has a chat with the ever-exuberant Emmy Lou.

title: New Chairs
description: Confusion reigns when the local department store delivers two new chairs to the wrong Nelson family and then drops off additional chairs or takes back the wrong pieces of Nelson's furniture.

title: The Boy's Paper Route
description: The boys just got a newspaper route, but it's Ozzie who winds up having to make the rounds on their first morning.

title: The Window Pane
description: Ozzie is falling behind on his list of chores around the house, so the rest of the family pitches in and helps out.

title: David's Pipe
description: An old friend of the family mails a monogrammed pipe to David, not realizing he isn't even college age, yet.

title: David's 17th Birthday
description: It's David's 17th birthday, and he's trying to do anything he can to look older because he has a crush on Sally Patterson, a girl who is only interested in older men.

title: No Noise
description: Herb Dunkle talks to Ozzie about a new organization in town, "The National Anti-Noise Society". But is this new club ready for Ozzie & Thorny to join?

title: Boys' Day
description: David and Will Thornberry's school essays give them both a chance to be mayor for the day during "Civic Day". Now if only Ozzie and Thorny will quit arguing about which son is going to be the honorable mayor.

title: The Suggestion Box
description: The Nelsons decide to start using a suggestion box for family matters.

title: The Ladder
description: Ozzie and Thorny get themselves marooned on a roof without a ladder.

title: Parental Guidance
description: David wants to start weightlifting and working out early in the morning, while Ricky wants to start staying up late and watching movies on the late show. Ozzie decides to let the boys have their way.

title: The Miracle
description: Ozzie tells his family a story from his childhood of when he wished for a white Christmas.

title: Ozzie's Night Out
description: The wife and kids give Ozzie the night off from helping them with their chores and homework, so with mixed feelings, he tries to amuse himself by spending a night out on the town.

title: David's Career
description: David's been spending time at Thompson's Garage. Ozzie thinks David may want to become a mechanic when he gets out of school. This is a great idea, until Ozzie talks to Thorny about what his son Will wants to do when he graduates.

title: The Initiation
description: Dave is in charge of his club's initiation committee, and Thorny's son Will is among the pledges that must undergo the process.

title: Ricky's Lost Letter
description: Ricky wants to send a letter to a cute girl who wrote to him, but Ozzie has accidentally destroyed the envelope containing her return address.

title: Father and Son Tournament
description: Both Dave and Ricky want Ozzie to partner with them for the Father And Son Table Tennis Tournament. The dilemma is that he can only play with one son.

title: Gentleman David
description: The school's Backward Dance is tonight. The girls invite the boys to this event. Fearing that David doesn't have a date to the dance, Ozzie meddles in his son's affairs.

title: David Writes a Column
description: David has a school assignment to write an article for the school paper. Unable to think of a subject to write about. Ozzie suggests writing an article about the school's baseball team and it's latest slump.

title: Over Protection
description: Ozzie and Harriet anguish over whether or not to allow 13-year-old Ricky to take a 150-mile train trip on his own.

title: Be on Time
description: It looks like Ozzie's going to be late to a luncheon where he's scheduled to deliver a speech on the importance of being on time.

title: An Evening with Hamlet
description: Ozzie and Thorny stage their version of "Hamlet" in the Nelson's living room.

title: New Neighbor
description: After meeting his new neighbor at the bank, Ozzie beliefs he's a thief and stole his penknife. When hinting to his new neighbor didn't solve the problem, Ozzie decided he needed to warn Thorny and put his valuables in the bank.

title: The Bird's Nest
description: Ozzie needs to have the roof gutter repaired before the next rain, but a bird's nest is holding up the works.

title: A Friend of the Family
description: Harriet writes to 'Aunt Martha', who gives advice through her 'A Friend of the Family' column in the local newspaper.

title: Operation Economy
description: After giving David a lecture on saving his money, Ozzie and Thorny indulge in some impulsive buying at the local sporting goods store.

title: Wedding Anniversary
description: Ozzie and Harriet must decide whether to celebrate their 19th wedding anniversary with a night on the town or to stay at home and chaperon a party for Ricky.

title: The Furnace
description: It's hot versus cold, as Ozzie and Harriet battle over setting the furnace's thermostat.

title: A Load of Gravel
description: Ozzie gets upset when the gravel Thornberry ordered is dumped in his yard instead. After a phone call, things get worse. Worse yet, Thornberry is down on his back and can't deal with the problem himself, which leaves only one person to take care of the mess.

title: Wally Dipple's Garage Door
description: Wally Dipple invents an unusual garage door opener. Ozzie and Thorny want to invest in it, but their plans hit a little snag.

title: Odd Bolt
description: Ozzie comes across a mysterious metal bolt, and sets about the house in search of where it's supposed to go.

title: A Matter of Inches
description: Ozzie agrees to pay David fifty dollars when he grows to be the same height as his dad.

title: The Fruitcake
description: When Harriet insists that everyone write thank you notes, Ozzie struggles to write his to Thorny.

title: The Bloodhound
description: Ricky tries to teach an old dog new tricks. Meanwhile, Ozzie and Thorny take drastic measures to avoid going to a violin recital with their wives, in order to stay home and watch the big fight on television, instead.

title: Individuality
description: Ozzie tries to derail Thorny's scheme to save money by having his house painted with the paint that is leftover from painting Ozzie's home. Ozzie demands that Thorny paint his house a different color than his. Meanwhile, Ricky gets permission to express his individuality by redecorating his half of the bedroom he shares with David.

title: Career Woman
description: After hearing a speech at the women's club about exciting careers for women. Harriet starts to think about pursuing a career of her own, something "old-fashioned" Ozzie is dead against.

title: The Girl Who Came to Dinner
Spring Housecleaning
description: Ozzie and Thorny are under extreme marital pressure to perform their annual spring cleaning chores.

title: Pajama Game
description: Dressed only in pajamas, Ozzie and Thorny embark on a bizarre adventure.

title: Ricky's Shadow
description: A little girl is following Ricky around, everywhere he goes. When Ozzie & Harriet try to talk to her, she runs away. Ozzie, Harriet, David, Ricky & even Thorny are trying to figure out what she wants.

title: David's Engagement
description: Circumstantial evidence leads Ozzie and Harriet to believe that David is about to get married.

title: An Invitation to Dinner
description: Ozzie accepts a dinner invitation from a friend he bumps into on the street. Trouble is - Ozzie won't confess he doesn't remember his friend's name nor where he lives. In fact, he doesn't even remember where he knows the guy from.

title: Music Appreciation
description: David doesn't like Ricky's jazz music records, and Ricky doesn't care for David's classical music records. It's a battle of the phonographs!

title: A Ball of Tinfoil
description: Ozzie rents a trailer to reduce closet clutter and take old belongings to the junkyard, but he cherishes much of the chattel, which he trades with neighbors. The neighbors' wives don't appreciate the junk, so it is all returned to Harriet. Ozzie eventually dumps all the items, including those received from the neighbors, greatly enhancing the appearance of the Nelson household.

title: Gay Blade
description: The 'Gay Blade' is a new kind of knife sharpener, which Harriet bought, and she expects non-mechanically inclined Ozzie to figure out how to correctly assemble its numerous parts.

title: Art Studies
description: Harriet thinks that she and Ozzie are not spending enough quality time together. Ozzie offers to take her golfing but Harriet has other plans.

title: Volunteer Fireman
description: Ozzie and Thorny decide to become volunteer firemen.

title: The Car Mix-Up
description: Both Ozzie and Harriet unintentionally steal two separate cars from the same stranger.

title: Watching Thorny's House
description: Ozzie & Thorny decide it would be a great idea to postpone their chores and go up to Pine Lake for the weekend. Harriet and the boys are busy, so Ozzie promises to look after Thorny's house, while the Thornberry's go up to the lake.

title: A Day in Bed
description: Ozzie is determined to stay in bed all day, but he soon finds out that it's not going to be as easy as he had first imagined.

title: Burried Treasure
description: While digging for worms to go fishing, Ricky discovers an old Spanish Doubloon. Soon afterwords, Ozzie, David and Ricky are digging a huge hole in the backyard.

title: A Beautiful Day
description: Ozzie greets a beautiful morning brimming with optimism, which soon turns to cynicism, which then turns to pessimism, which eventually turns to complete gloom.

title: Captain Salty and the Submarine
description: Ozzie is curious as to how a certain toy submarine works, so he sends in 6 Salty root beer bottle caps plus 50 cents to a cartoon television program, in order to obtain one. As usual, the results are unexpected.

title: The Banjo Player
description: The rocking jazz band that Ricky plays drums in gets their first job playing at a sorority dance. Ozzie thinks they would sound much better with a banjo, so he tries to horn in on the act.

title: Pool Table
description: Ozzie goes to the store to buy filing cabinets for the boys' bedroom - and comes home with a pool table, instead.

title: David Picks Up the Tab
description: David treats his parents and date to dinner at an upscale restaurant, but it's possible he may not have enough money to cover the tab.

title: A Doctor in the House
description: The Nelsons put Doc Williams up at their house for a few days. Ozzie becomes paranoid that the doctor is plotting to remove his tonsils against his will.

title: The Busy Christmas
description: Ozzie volunteers for so many Christmas committees that he has little time to do his Christmas shopping, hang the Christmas lights or buy a Christmas tree.

title: The Day After Christmas
description: Feeling nostalgic on the day after Christmas, Ozzie is determined to take the family ice skating up at the lake.

title: Ozzie's Double
description: A stranger with a British accent is passing through town, and he looks exactly like Ozzie. It's bad enough that he's been seen about town with an attractive young redhead - he's a wanted pickpocket, too.

title: Hairstyle for Harriet
description: Ozzie becomes quite anxious, when Harriet goes to a beauty parlor to get a new look.

title: The Puppy
description: Ozzie and the boys surprise Harriet with a Beagle puppy on her birthday, but the puppy has a surprise of his own for all of them.

title: Like Father, Like Son
description: A series of coincidences start around the Nelson household, starting with David telling his parents that he has just started dating a girl, whose name just happens to be Harriet.

title: The Duenna
description: David invites a pretty Spanish girl to a dance knowing she doesn't speak a word of English, but doesn't count on her bringing her duenna as a chaperon.

title: Hot Dog Stand
description: David, Wally, and Chuck take over management of the campus hot dog stand.

title: The Reading Room
description: It's lonely at the top. That's because Harriet converted some upstairs space into a reading room for Ozzie. Now he feels left out of family activities - mainly watching TV.

title: The Clubhouse
description: The Tigers are planning on building a clubhouse and Ozzie unwittingly volunteers to let them build it in his backyard.

title: The Jet Pilot
description: Ozzie gets a chance to fly in a jet fighter plane.

title: Ozzie and Harriet Go to Washington
The Editor
description: Harriet is elected editor of the Woman's Club News. Ozzie gets involved, and things go awry.

title: Hawaiian Party
description: Ozzie, Harriet, David and Ricky attend a Hawaiian luau.

title: Ricky, the Drummer
description: The Tommy Jackson Band is coming to town, and Ricky dreams of sitting in on drums.

roles.char: Woman Who Wishes She Were 20 Years Younger

title: Ozzie, the Treasurer
description: Ozzie has been treasurer of the men's lodge for the past three years, which is two years too many as far as he is concerned. Now he is balancing the books for the next elected treasurer.

title: Taking Care of Freddy
description: Oz agrees to babysit a small boy's pet named Freddie, but he misunderstands just what sort of pet Freddie is.

title: The Loan
description: Ozzie and Darby are furious with each other over the matter of a questionable ten-dollar debt.

title: Man Without a Family
description: After Ricky and his friends find another house at which to hang out, Ozzie learns that silence is not always golden.

title: Treasurer's Report
description: Ozzie goes to great effort to present the Men's Club treasury report, but it seems no one is interested, until a little side-benefit is discovered.

title: Ricky's Big Night
description: Rick wants to go out with a new girl, but she doesn't date high school boys, so Rick uses Dave's fraternity ring and pin to get a date with her.

title: Ozzie's Triple Banana Surprise
description: Ozzie has a restless night, after he downs two double-banana torpedoes.

title: Tutti-Frutti Ice Cream
description: Thoughts and dreams of Tutti-Frutti ice cream prompt Ozzie and Darby to embark on an all-night quest in search of the flavor needed to satisfy their craving.

title: Christmas Tree Lot
description: David and Rick decide to earn some extra cash to buy Christmas presents by opening up a Christmas tree lot, but soon discover that being a small-time entrepreneurs is a lot more involved than they had realized.

title: The Trophy
description: The Nelsons compete against other neighborhood families in the Men's Club picnic decathlon.

title: The Road Race
description: Ozzie fixes up an old-time car so he can enter a race against a modern hotrod. Will it be another race of the tortoise versus the hare?

roles.char: Woman in Crowd at Finish Line

title: David and the Stewardess
description: Dave meets a beautiful blonde stewardess on a flight, but constant interruptions and chance run-ins with one of the airline's pilots prevent them from having time alone on several attempted dates.

title: Picture in Rick's Notebook
description: After an 8x10 photo of a beautiful mystery girl falls out of Rick's notebook, he tries to find out who she is. He wants a date with her.

title: Harriet's Dancing Partner
description: Harriet goes dancing with an old dancing partner, while a nervous Ozzie stays home and plays poker with the guys.

title: Who Is Betty?
description: Ricky tries to secretly juggle three dates with three girls named Betty at the "Girls Asks Boy" Dance.

title: Old Band Pavilion
description: Ozzie spearheads a campaign to bring back live band music to the park pavilion.

title: Practical Joker
description: Ozzie and Darby wager on whether Darby can pull a practical joke on Ozzie within one week. With just one day left to go, Ozzie has is guard up, and he decides to attempt to play a practical joke on Darby.

title: Scavenger Hunt
description: Ozzie, Darby, Doc, and Joe challenge their wives to a scavenger hunt, in order to determine which is the smarter sex.

title: The Closed Circuit
description: Joe Randolph and Ozzie play a prank on their wives. It backfires, of course.

title: Top Gun
description: Ozzie tries to win a tepee for the neighborhood kids, by entering a contest to outdraw cowboy and western TV star Tex Barton.

title: Record Trout
description: Ozzie & Darby both claim they caught a large record making trout for the Men's Club, while fishing. This problem is made worse after they take the fish to the taxidermist.

title: The Bachelor
description: Ozzie and Harriet play Cupid in their effort to get their actor-friend, inveterate bachelor John Archer, married.

title: Rick's Chemistry Grade
description: Oz runs into a teacher that informs him that if his son doesn't pick up his work in chemistry, he'll get a failing grade, so he high pressures Rick into studying harder, and forgoing his social life.

title: The Magic of Three
description: Ozzie, Darby, Doc, and Butch are scheduled to be singing waiters at the Women's Club luncheon. Darby makes a bet with a nervous Ozzie that Ozzie won't make it through the event without breaking something.

title: Ozzie and the Bridge Group
description: Ozzie's new neighbor causes him to reassess what he does with his leisure time. He gives up bridge and tries golf, painting, horseback riding and going to the fights and finds he doesn't enjoy any of these pastimes.

title: A Cruise for Harriet
description: When Ozzie announces he will take a week off from work and go on a fishing trip, Harriet decides to go on an ocean cruise by herself.

title: A Surprise for Clara
description: Ozzie's birthday is on Saturday, it's also the Randolph's 25th anniversary on Monday. Joe wants to redecorate their home as a present for Clara. He asks Ozzie's help on how to get Clara to go to her Mother's for the weekend.

title: The Pony
description: Ozzie unknowingly wins a pony in a contest which makes him very popular with the neighborhood children.

title: Ozzie's Daughters
description: Ozzie and Harriet take in two teenage girls, while Dave and Rick temporarily stay elsewhere. Ozzie gets in a panic when his two "daughters" go missing, while on a late-night date with Dave and Rick.

title: Rick's Riding Lesson
description: Wally, Rick and Dave decide to go horseback riding. When Rick spots a beautiful young instructor he pretends to be a novice and offers to exchange guitar lessons for riding lessons.

title: The Motorcycle
description: Dave is considering buying a used motorcycle, and Harriet wants Ozzie to talk him out of it.

title: The Runaways
description: Ozzie discovers two small children hiding in the backseat of his car.

title: Rick's Dinner Guests
description: Rick is expecting his new girlfriend and her parents over for dinner, but Ozzie fouls things up by mistakenly telling Rick that dinner is at the girlfriend's house, instead. Meanwhile, Harriet goes to the movies, and Ozzie invites his buddies over for a poker game, leaving Rick stuck in the middle.

title: Ozzie and the Space Age
description: When the Bijou Theater offers $1,000 to anyone who can get a picture of a flying saucer, Ozzie decides to have some fun and fake a photograph, but soon learns that his photo may be real.

title: Jealous Joe Randolph
description: Clara asks Ozzie to help her select a fishing rod for her husband's birthday, but their secret rendezvous causes Joe suspects his wife of infidelity.

title: Newspaper Interview
description: Darby thinks Ozzie is jealous because he was selected "Neighbor of the Week" and has his picture in the town newspaper.

title: The Exploding Book
description: Dave and Wally are both dating the same young lady. Dave is invited to the girl's birthday party, but accidentally picks up the box with the wrong gift - a book that will explode when opened.

title: Togetherness
description: After Ozzie and Harriet attend a lecture on the topic of 'Togetherness', the Nelsons decide to do more things together as a family.

title: The Treasurer's Son
description: The fraternity is unhappy with Wally's performance as their treasurer, and when Rick opens his mouth at the wrong time, he gets railroaded into taking over the duties. When the fraternity decides to rent the Men's Club for their dance, Ozzie, the treasurer of the club, winds up going through some sticky negotiations with his son, Rick, who is the fraternity's treasurer.

title: The Little Black Box
description: Harriet and Clara bet their husbands that men have more curiosity than women. To prove their point, they put a lock on a box and bet the men that they'll force open the box to learn its contents before the weekend.

title: The Buckingham
description: David & Ricky buy an old English car, a Buckingham. Although they enjoy it at first, the upkeep of the car winds up costing them more than they can afford.

title: Ozzie Plans a Surprise
description: After learning from his two sons that he talks in his sleep, Ozzie worries he'll reveal Harriet's upcoming birthday surprise. He takes unusual measures to prevent this from happening.

title: Sea Captain
description: One of Ozzie's old college friends, now a sea captain, invites Dave to join him on his next round-the-world cruise - much to Ozzie and Harriet's consternation.

title: David, the Law Clerk
description: Dave applies for a job as a clerk for a influential law firm and worries that all of his family's coincidental meetings with the partner making the selection will be held against him.

title: The Nelsons Decide to Move
description: Dave and Rick are growing up and aren't as home as much as they used to be, so Ozzie and Harriet look into selling the old family house and moving into an apartment.

title: David, the Sleuth
description: While bowling one evening, Dave spots a man bowling that he believes is seeking an insurance settlement from one his law firm's clients. With Rick's assistance, Dave tries to supply proof that the man is perfectly healthy.

title: Fathers' Night at the Fraternity House
description: The fraternity brothers are short of funds for the swimming pool they want to build in back of the frat house, so they plan to put the squeeze on their fathers by luring them to a Dad's Night steak dinner.

title: Happy Anniversary
description: Harriet and Ozzie both make plans to surprise the other on their anniversary.

title: Rick Gets Even
description: A beautiful girl breaks a dance date with Rick.

title: Ozzie Keeps a Secret
description: The parents of a girl that Rick is dating ask Ozzie & Harriet for their help in planning a surprise birthday party for their daughter. Ozzie originally intends to tell Rick but suddenly has a change of heart about telling him.

title: Dave's Car Payments
description: David panics when he gets a letter informing him that he's missed a series of car payments and his car could be repossessed.

title: The Circus
description: David's boss assigns him the difficult task of serving a summons upon the father of a girl that he's interested in getting to know better.

title: Dave Goofs Off
description: David has never met his other boss, senior partner Mr. Kelley, who is back in town. David wants to make a good first-impression, but no matter how hard he tries, a comedy of errors seems to have "pink slip" written all over it.

title: Magic Dishes
description: Mystifying events occur after Ozzie and his friends make fun of a romantic story attached to a set of heirloom dishes once owned by Harriet's great-grandmother.

title: The T-Shirts
description: One of the founders of the Men's Club is returning to town and Ozzie's in charge of getting T-shirts welcoming him back. He becomes stuck with 31 shirts saying "Welcome Back Skinny" because the guys think the nickname is undignified for a man who's made it big and isn't skinny anymore.

title: Dave and the Schoolteacher
description: David strikes up a relationship with an old elementary school classmate, who has now grown up to be a beautiful elementary school teacher.

title: Forgotten Promise
description: Ozzie and Joe try to duck out on a promise they made to their wives that they would attend an upcoming lecture with them.

title: No News for Harriet
description: Harriet has been hearing neighborhood news and gossip through the grapevine when she could be hearing it first from Ozzie, so she asks him to keep her more abreast of what he learns when he's out and about.

title: Weekend Vacation
description: Ozzie & Harriet make plans to go to the lodge at the lake, for the weekend. Harriet happens to mention this to Clara Randolph, who thinks it would be a great idea if she and Joe came along.

title: David Gets Discouraged
description: After Dave's boss, Mr. Kelley, asks him to do several menial tasks, Dave feels like he's not getting anywhere in the law profession, so he considers quitting his job and entering the advertising field.

title: Ozzie, the Boat-Keeper
description: Joe Randolph buys a new boat without telling his wife. He then makes Ozzie cover for him, until he summons up the courage to tell Clara about the boat.

title: His Brother's Girl
description: Dave falls for Rick's girlfriend, Jane, and the feeling is mutual. Dave invites Jane to a dance and can't decide how to break the news to his brother.

title: The Table and the Painting
description: Ozzie admires a table built by Joe Randolph, so Joe gives it to him. Ozzie then feels compelled to give an old picture he painted to Joe. Both friends suspect each others motives.

title: A Sweater for Rick
description: Rick's girlfriend is secretly knitting him a sweater. When she turns down several dates to work on the project he begins to date another girl, who also knits him a sweater. Now Rick has two sweaters and two girlfriends to juggle.

title: A Friend in Need
description: Ozzie begins to question whether he can count on his friends when the chips are down.

title: David's Almost In-Laws
description: When Ozzie and Harriet are invited to Dave's girlfriend's house for dinner, they assume that the two youngsters are about to announce their engagement.

title: David Hires a Secretary
description: When Mr Kelley's secretary goes on vacation, Dave is assigned the task of hiring a temporary replacement.

title: A Lawnmower for Ozzie
description: Ozzie and Rick break into the Randolph's garage to retrieve the lawnmower that Joe borrowed but never returned.

title: Girl in the Emporium
description: Ricky and Wally notice a pretty sales clerk in a store and try to get jobs for the Christmas shopping rush in the same department.

title: A Piano for the Fraternity
description: David and Rick's fraternity tries to find an affordable piano to use for their upcoming Christmas party. The brothers are just about to give up when they meet the Stewarts who offer them their old, but serviceable, upright piano. The boys find a sheaf of Christmas carols in the piano stool and convince their fraternity brothers to invite all their parents to the party - and the Stewarts, too - for an evening of Christmas carols, dance and punch.

title: Rick Counts the Ballots
description: Rick is in charge of the committee counting the votes to elect a new Prom Queen. His girlfriend is among the candidates, and Rick does his best to keep the winner's identity a secret from her and everyone else until the prom.

title: The Girl That Loses Things
description: Rick's girlfriend becomes jealous when he keeps bumping into a klutzy girl.

title: Safe Husbands
description: Ozzie and Joe scheme to make their wives jealous.

title: The Chaperones
description: Ozzie & Harriet volunteer to be chaperone's at a party for Rick's fraternity. But there seems to be some confusion as to where the party is going to be held at.

title: Our Man in Alaska
description: A reporter for the college newspaper always seems to know all about the activities of Dave and Rick's fraternity. The fraternity brothers are convinced that Rick is supplying her with inside information.

title: Two Small Boys and a Dog
description: Two little boys find a dog, and they ask Dave to decide which of them should be its owner. To complicate matters, the little boys are brothers of Dave and Rick's girlfriends.

title: The Boys' Portraits
description: A pretty college student paints a portrait of Rick, but Ozzie and Harriet are afraid that Dave will become jealous.

title: Dave's Golf Story
description: Dave has a great golf story, but Wally submits it to the attractive campus newspaper editor as his own.

title: Rick's Broken Arm
description: As part of an elaborate hoax to help get Wally out of hot water with Ginger, Ricky agrees to pretend to have a broken arm by wearing a cast on it.

title: Little House Guest
description: The Nelson's friend, little boy Barry, is expecting a new arrival to his family, and he hopes it's going to be a baby brother. He spends a few nights at the Nelson's, while his mother goes to the hospital "to pick up the baby".

title: The Manly Arts
description: Harriet fears the most sinister worst, when Dave and Rick take on a task of delivering a shipping crate containing valuable works of art late at night.

title: A Question of Suits and Ties
description: The sorority girls issue a proclamation dictating a dress code that must be adhered to by fraternity boys, when going out on dates. The fraternity boys fight back, and the war of the sexes escalates from there.

title: The Pen and Pencil Set
description: Harriet asks Ozzie to check for gift ribbon in the hall closet. When a box of wrapping paper falls on the floor, a small unmarked Christmas present is found and the Nelson family tries to figure out who it is from.

title: Selling Rick's Drums
description: With the help of Bruce, Dave schemes to secretly sell Rick's old drum set to a pretty girl, who both he and Rick want to meet and ask out on a date.

title: E.S.P.
description: Ozzie and Joe make a bet with their wives that they can prove men have greater extra sensory perception than women.

title: Rick's 21st Birthday
description: Rick's late Great-Uncle Walter left an envelope for Rick to be opened on his 21st birthday, and the entire Nelson household can hardly wait to find out what's inside.

title: Built in TV Set
description: Getting a free used television set from neighbor Joe becomes a very expensive proposition for Ozzie.

title: Dancing Lessons
description: Ozzie and Joe get roped into going to the Women's Club Annual Dinner Dance, so they secretly take dancing lessons at a downtown studio in hopes of impressing their wives.

title: The Newlyweds Get Settled
description: While Dave and June are on their honeymoon, Harriet decides to unpack their wedding gifts and fix up their new apartment without their knowledge or permission.

title: The Fraternity Rents Out a Room
description: The fraternity brothers rent out a room to one of their professors. Naturally, it doesn't work out very well, and the boys have got to figure out a way to get him to move back out.

title: Rick Grades a Test
description: Rick is put in a position where he must grade his girlfriend's English exam.

roles.char: Man in Back Row Aisle Seat

title: The Barking Dog
description: Ozzie needs to go to sleep, so he can get up early in the morning to go fishing, but a barking dog is making sleep impossible.

title: Rick Comes to Dinner
description: Rick and his date get invited to Dave and June's apartment for dinner. After Dave talks to June about it, to make sure it's okay, he finds out that Rick's date is one of his old girlfriends. Someone he's never mentioned to June.

title: The Trading Stamps
description: Harriet is keeping seventy books of trading stamps in a kitchen drawer, which the Women's Club has saved and plans to redeem for a fancy gift to give to their retiring president at this evening's banquet. In the meantime, Ozzie, Joe, and Darby find the books and cash them in on sporting goods for themselves.

title: Rick, the Milkman
description: To make some extra money, Rick agrees to substitute for the vacationing milkman. In addition to the hard-earned cash, Rick discovers the job has a fringe benefit - meeting a beautiful customer first thing every morning.

title: The Fraternity Pin
description: Rick feels pressured into pinning a girl he's been dating for only a few weeks.

title: Backyard Pet Show
description: Ozzie tells the neighborhood kids they can hold a pet show in his backyard, and then gets stuck by their parents with the unwanted responsibility of being the judge.

title: The Special Cake
description: June bakes a special cake for Dave, in hopes he'll remember the first anniversary of his marriage proposal.

title: The Randolph's Niece
description: The Randolphs and Ozzie and Harriet hear wedding bells when Ricky goes out with the Randolph's niece. However, Ricky and the girl aren't really that interested in each other.

title: A Lamp for Dave & June
description: June finds the perfect lamp for their new apartment, but Dave claims they can't afford to purchase any household items.

title: Operation Barry
description: Barry is scheduled to have Doc Williams take out his tonsils, but he goes missing the day before the operation.

title: Making Wally Study
description: Rick and Wally's fraternity house is in danger of being put on scholastic probation, which means Wally must improve his study habits. To help out, Rick dates Ginger while Wally studies.

title: Lending Money to Wally
description: Rick and his fellow fraternity brothers find a sneaky way to help Wally out of a monetary jam.

title: Lonesome Parents
description: Ozzie and Harriet become upset when they don't hear from David and June.

title: Little Handprints in the Sidewalk
description: Ozzie and Harriet must replace their damaged sidewalk, and become sentimental over a section containing cement hand prints made by David and Ricky in 1945 when they were little. After saving the section, they don't know what to do with it.

title: Rick and the Maid of Honor
description: Rick, serving as the best man at a wedding, is embarrassed by the attention he receives from the maid-of-honor, because he's not attracted to her at all.

title: The Trip to Mexico
description: Rick tells David about their parents plans to head south of the border. What started out as an exciting idea, turns out to be more than they bargained for.

title: The Tigers Go to a Dance
description: Harriet promotes a dance for elementary school-aged children, but forgets that eight-year-old boys have no interest in girls or dancing. She turns to her husband, Ozzie, for help.

title: The Women's Club Play
description: The women's club elect Ozzie to be in charge of organizing the annual children's play. Things don't work out as planned and they are unable to agree on what the play should be about or who is going to write it.

title: Rick Sends a Picture
description: Rick's in a jam after he accidentally sends a photograph of himself to a girl he hardly knows. It was intended for his grandmother, and he signed it, "To my favorite girl, with love from Rick."

title: Rick, the Host
description: Rick wants to spend some quiet alone-time with a beautiful new girl on campus, but Wally keeps getting in the way.

title: Losing Miss Edwards
description: Dave and his boss, Mr. Kelley, are at a loss when Miss Edwards unexpectedly hands in her letter of resignation.

title: An Old Friend of June's
description: Dave and June have anxious thoughts about each other, when Dave is stuck working late in the office with a gorgeous blonde secretary, while June is at home entertaining an old boyfriend of hers.

title: June and the Great Outdoors
description: Dave takes a frightened June camping.

title: The Girl at the Ski Lodge
Roadside Courtesy
description: Harriet and Clara run out of gas in the middle of nowhere.

title: Dave and the Teenager
description: New neighbors have moved in down the hall from Dave and June's apartment. Their 14-year-old daughter quickly develops an annoying crush on Dave.

title: Any Date in a Storm
description: Rick and Wally find themselves frantically juggling two pairs of dates at a fancy new restaurant.

title: Decorating Dave's Office
description: Dave consults a professional decorator after June suggests that his office could use some sprucing up. When Dave learns that June plans on doing the work herself, he becomes afraid of hurting her feelings by using a professional.

title: Publicity for the Fraternity
description: After a dismal turnout for the fraternity's dance, Rick and his frat brothers try to come up with a way to drum up publicity.

title: Women's Club Bazaar
description: Clara Randolph has made some very ugly clay ashtrays to sell at the Women's Club Bazaar, and Doc Williams has found an unusual use for them.

title: Dave and the Fraternity Lease
description: The fraternity's house lease has expired, and a sorority wants to move in, so the frat brothers look to Dave for legal advice.

title: June Music Festival
description: Rick Nelson hosts a show within a show. His rock and roll band play a number of songs, while singers Jennie Smith, The Brothers Four and Bud & Travis as well as The Garrett Square Dancers also perform.

title: Secret Agent
description: June becomes convinced that Dave is a secret agent for the FBI.

title: Ozzie, Joe and the Fashion Models
description: Once again, Ozzie and Joe pull a gag in hopes of making their wives jealous. This time it involves taking photos of themselves posed in friendly positions with fashion models.

title: Rick's Wedding Ring
description: Newlywed Rick unwittingly accepts a date with a sorority girl to the "Girl Asks Boy Dance". What if his wife Kris finds out?

title: Blue Moose
description: The frat house is in sore need of a fresh coat of paint, so Wally devises a risky scheme to get another fraternity to do the work for them.

title: David Takes a Client to Dinner
Wally's Pen Pal
description: Wally has carried on a years-long pen pal relationship with an attractive girl, whom he's never met in person. His letters have been full of lies about how great he is, but worst of all, he sent her a picture of Rick, writing that it was a picture of himself. Now she's flying into town, and Wally has talked Rick into impersonating him when they meet her at the airport.

title: David and the Mermaid
description: David is in an ocean of trouble with June when he goes missing with a beautiful mermaid.

title: The Swami
description: Ozzie and Harriet decide to pull a prank on each other when Ozzie disguises himself as a swami fortune teller at a University Woman's Club function.

title: A Wife in the Office
description: David's wife June fills in at his office while his secretary is on vacation.

title: Hayride
description: Harriet & Clara think it would be very romantic to organize a hayride for the girls in the women's club and their husbands. But Ozzie & Joe are planning a big poker game for the same night.

title: Rick, the Law Clerk
description: Judge Roberts pressures Dave into interviewing the judge's nephew for the new law clerk job opening at Dave's law office. However, unbeknown to the judge, Dave has already hired Rick. Now, what can Dave do to get out of this jam?

title: Rick Is Late for Dinner
description: Kris plans a special dinner for Rick and his folks. Meanwhile, Jack has a family commitment, so he leaves Wally in charge at the Campus Malt Shop for one night. What could go wrong? Plenty.

title: A Letter About Harriet
description: After the local newspaper prints a husband's love letter to his wife, Ozzie and Joe feel pressured by their wives to do the same.

title: Rick and the Girl Across the Hall
Rick and Kris Go to the Mountains
description: Rick and his fraternity brothers plan on holding an all-night poker game at his in-laws' mountain cabin. However, unknown to Rick, Kris thinks that Rick is planning a getaway for just the two of them.

title: The Pennies
description: A pair of neighborhood boys ask Ozzie to hold their jar of pennies for safekeeping. Ozzie invites his friends over for a poker game and, strapped for funds, borrows the kids' change as a gambling stake, not realizing that the coins were part of a valuable collection.

title: The Ballerina
description: Harriet enlists Kris, Rick, and his fraternity brothers to help out with entertaining the kids at the Women's Club Annual Children's Show. Ozzie wants to get into the act, too.

title: A Bedtime Story
description: As part of a college prank prompted by the new dean, Rick has to literally stay in bed for an entire week, no matter where he goes.

title: Harriet's Quiz
description: Ozzie gets a so-so score on Harriet's marital quiz. He begins to wonder whether he has run out of things to say to her. Darby eventually helps to put everything into perspective for his anxious friend.

title: Kris Plays Cupid
description: There's double-trouble after Kris tries to play Cupid with Wally and Ginger.

title: Exotic Housemother
description: As part of a publicity stunt, Rick's college frat house allows Bubbles La Tassle, an exotic dancer from the Zimbo Zambo Club, to pose as their housemother, but when she spends the night, they worry the dean will find out and expel them from school.

title: Chess Set
description: Ozzie discovers a neighborhood boy with a talent for chess is betting on his ability to win matches.

title: Cafe Caper
description: Ozzie, Dave, and Rick get mixed up with a caf robbery.

title: The Petition
description: While Mr. Kelley is out of town and unreachable, a woman visits the law office to arrange a transfer of $20,000 to a relative in Mexico City. Rick becomes suspicious that she may be impersonating the real client, so he schemes to find out the truth.

title: Rick Grows a Beard
description: Rick decides to grow a beard, much to his wife's disgust. When Rick's friends and relations decide to go one better and wear "fully grown" fake beards, disaster ensues.

title: The Big Dog
description: Will Rick wind up in the doghouse, after he surprises Kris with a Great Dane on her birthday?

title: The Trunk
description: Hoping to find hidden treasure, Ozzie and Joe purchase a locked mystery trunk at auction.

title: Kris' Girlfriend
description: Sally, an old girlfriend of Kris, moves into town. She overstays her welcome at Rick and Kris's house, while she takes forever looking for an apartment.

title: Rick's Raise
description: Rick feels under-paid and under-appreciated, so he quits his job as Dave's law clerk.

title: Breakfast for Harriet
description: Ozzie cancels a golf date to stay home and make breakfast for Harriet, who is in bed with a cold. As usual, things don't go as planned.

title: Painting from the Past
description: One of Rick's high school girl friends, now engaged, returns a landscape of their favorite picnic grounds he painted for her years ago. Rick wants to hang the picture in their living room, but his wife is somewhat jealous since he's never done anything artistic for her. In order for both members of the family to save face, Rick convinces Wally agrees to break into the Nelson's house and steal the picture.

title: Tangled Web
description: It's becomes a tangled web, indeed, after Clara tries to impress an old friend by fooling her into believing Ozzie is her husband.

title: A Rose a Day
description: A rose a day from a secret admirer is being delivered to Harriet, and it's driving Ozzie crazy trying to find out who it is.

title: Kris & the Queen
description: Once again, Wally and Ginger are on the outs, so Kris and Rick help to set him up on a date to the dance with the Prom Queen in hopes of making Ginger jealous.

title: Helpful June
description: June is bored being a housewife and jumps at the chance to help Dave at his office. A misunderstanding at lunch, has June tailing a client of the law firm Dave works at. It gets really confusing when Harriet and Ozzie get involved.

title: The Prowler
description: While hiding out from the Randolphs, Ozzie is mistaken for a prowler in his own home.

title: A Message from Kris
description: Kris has left an important message for Rick. The trouble is, Wally has torn it into six pieces to use as paper to write IOUs, which he has issued to several fraternity brothers. Rick now has to hunt them down, redeeming them along the way.

title: Flying Down to Lunch
description: Harriet and Clara accuse Ozzie and Joe of being set in their ways and never doing anything different. So when a friend of Joe offers to take them along on an errand, by airplane, the boys decide to go with him and have lunch in Mexico.

title: The Equestrian
description: Rick and Kris buy a horse they can't afford.

title: Dave, the Worrier
description: June talks Dave into taking some time off. Dave leaves Rick in charge of the office and he and June head up to a cabin on the lake for a few days. But Dave can't relax and worries that Rick might not be able to handle things by himself.

title: The Ghost Town
description: Ozzie and Harriet unexpectedly wind up spending the night in a ghost town.

title: Kris, the Little Helper
description: Kris is worn out from doing favors for Rick and his fraternity brothers.

title: Wally's Traffic Ticket
description: Wally hires Dave to defend him against a traffic ticket charge.

title: An Honor for Oz
description: In return for all that he has done for them, The Tigers Club (ten neighborhood boys) give Ozzie a gift: a sporty hat that he hates, and the boys continually pester him to see if he is wearing it.

title: Ozzie-a-Go-Go
description: Ozzie wants to show up his neighbor Joe, so he asks Kris to teach him the steps and moves to the latest dance craze.

title: Trip Trap
description: With Harriet's help, June tries to trap Dave into taking a trip to Hawaii, and with the help of Ozzie, Rick, and Wally, Dave tries not to trip into her trap.

title: Waiting for Joe
description: Joe is consistently late which really irritates Ozzie. A picnic at the lake, planned for the next day, starts with both couples leaving together and ends with the Nelson's and the Randolph's coming back home at different times.

title: Rick's Assistant
description: Dave hires Joel, a bright nine-year-old boy, as Rick's law clerk assistant, which soon threatens to put Rick out of a job.

title: Dave's Other Office
description: The sprinkler system in Dave's law office springs a major leak, so he is forced to work at home. The trouble is, it's impossible to get any work done with June around.

title: Ozzie, the Babysitter
description: Ozzie reluctantly takes care of little Joel Harvey when his parents cannot find another sitter. Ozzie then breaks a slot car set that was supposed to be a surprise for Joel's birthday. With help from Harriet, Dave, and Thorny, Ozzie secretly replaces the toy.

title: The Game Room
description: Ozzie and Harriet desire to convert the boys old bedroom into something else. Harriet suggests a guest bedroom, but Ozzie secretly wants to buy a used pool table and convert the space into a game room.
